intro: Senecio varvarcensis var. varvarcensis, commonly known as the Varvarcensis Senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small perennial, with narrow, linear leaves and yellowish to orange-colored flowers. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies of Mediterranean-type ecosystems.
